Hampshire – All mobile libraries to cease from June.
Bexley – Bostall Library re-opens as volunteer run.
Bristol – Eastville Library closed. Strike of library workers over changes to working conditions/hours.
Shropshire – Council decides not to move Church Stretton Library, moments before judicial review was to be heard (press release below).
Brighton and Hove – Rottingdean to have remote-control Open+ at cost of £23k to increase hours.
Dorset – Confirmed school library service will close in July, 7 staff cut.
Leicestershire – 30% cut on top of deep cuts in previous years. Consultation.
Powys – Up to 11 smaller libraries under threat: 50% cut expected. Consultation until July.

Worcestershire – £1m cut. 78.5 hours per week to be cut. "Unstaffed" opening hours. Increased library fees. "demand up-front payments for transactions." £250k cut to Hive, £250k by "extra library commissioning". Mobile library "to be hired".
North Somerset – Children’s centres and libraries to be co-located (£500k cut overall).
Sheffield – Part of council supported but volunteer-run Walkley Library to be converted into a privately run bar.
Southampton – Burgess Road Library now run by volunteers, led by local church.
